description: Grade II listed building which, together with other premises on Cavendish Square, shares a rich history as the first development on the 2nd Earl of Oxford's London estate. Home to the General Representation of Flanders, Visit Flanders and Flanders Investment & Trade.

designers.architect: Edward Wilcox and Francis Smith of Warwick

events.name: Drop in: Flanders House Open Day
events.notes: The area will be open to walk around in, and there will (probably) be an exhibition element to it about Flemish Architecture.

factsheet.heading: Flanders House
paragraphs:
Flanders House is home to three departments of the government of Flanders in the UK, which is part of the Embassy of Belgium. The property is a grade II-listed property on Cavendish Square. The building and square have an amazing history and are in great location in Central London.
Flanders House underwent an extensive renovation in 2023. During this renovation the period features were of course kept, but new modern elements were added, alongside some Flemish design.

name: Flanders House
